result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daquane DeAndre Nichols

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daquane DeAndre Nichols not in court.  Attorney Maryann Corea in court for Daquane DeAndre Nichols.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in Court for Pretrial Conference. 
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. 
Court orders case adjourned for Calendar Call in Branch 13.
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Calendar call scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with MKW; Gregory Hunter unless in an official capacity.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Daquane DeAndre Nichols appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Maryann Corea appeared by video for Daquane DeAndre Nichols.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Triggiano, Branch 13.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
